statements: SELECT * FROM fraud_detection WHERE is_fraudulent = true;
SELECT transaction_id, customer_id FROM fraud_detection WHERE transaction_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_id, transaction_date FROM fraud_detection ORDER BY transaction_date DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM fraud_detection WHERE transaction_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT AVG(transaction_amount) FROM fraud_detection WHERE is_fraudulent = false;
SELECT * FROM fraud_detection WHERE is_fraudulent = True;
SELECT customer_id, transaction_amount FROM fraud_detection WHERE transaction_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM fraud_detection ORDER BY transaction_amount DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(transaction_id) AS total_transactions FROM fraud_detection GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT AVG(transaction_amount) AS average_transaction_amount FROM fraud_detection WHERE is_fraudulent = True;
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions;
SELECT transaction_id, amount, transaction_date FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM suspicious_users;
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions ORDER BY transaction_date DESC;
SELECT user_id, username FROM suspicious_users WHERE is_suspicious = true;
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY transaction_date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT user_id, count(transaction_id) FROM fraudulent_transactions GROUP BY user_id HAVING count(transaction_id) > 5 ORDER BY count(transaction_id) DESC;
SELECT user_id, registration_date FROM suspicious_users WHERE is_suspicious = TRUE AND registration_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY registration_date ASC;
SELECT user_id, username FROM suspicious_users WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com%' OR email LIKE '%@yahoo.com%' ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT t.amount, u.username FROM fraudulent_transactions t JOIN suspicious_users u ON t.user_id = u.user_id WHERE u.is_suspicious = TRUE ORDER BY t.amount DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions;
SELECT transaction_id, amount, transaction_date FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT pattern_id, pattern_description, detection_date FROM fraud_patterns WHERE pattern_type = 'credit card fraud' ORDER BY detection_date DESC;
SELECT activity_id, activity_date, description FROM suspicious_activity WHERE activity_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31';
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE account_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY transaction_date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT transaction_id, amount FROM fraudulent_transactions WHERE transaction_date >= '2022-01-01' AND transaction_date <= '2022-12-31';
SELECT account_id, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM fraudulent_transactions GROUP BY account_id HAVING SUM(amount) > 5000;
SELECT f.transaction_id, s.description FROM fraudulent_transactions f JOIN suspicious_activity s ON f.transaction_id = s.transaction_id;
SELECT pattern_description, COUNT(*) AS occurrences FROM fraud_patterns GROUP BY pattern_description ORDER BY occurrences DESC;
SELECT * FROM fraudsters;
SELECT id, name, address FROM fraudsters WHERE fraud_score > 80;
SELECT transaction_id, timestamp, amount, merchant FROM transactions ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT alert_id, alert_message, status FROM alerts WHERE status = 'pending';
SELECT review_id, reviewer, review_date, review_comment FROM reviews WHERE reviewer = 'Alice';
SELECT * FROM fraudsters;
SELECT name, address, birthdate FROM fraudsters WHERE fraud_score > 50;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_alerts FROM alerts WHERE status = 'pending';
SELECT transaction_id, amount, timestamp, merchant, name AS customer_name FROM transactions JOIN fraudsters ON transactions.customer_id = fraudsters.id;
SELECT reviews.review_id, alerts.alert_message, reviews.reviewer, reviews.review_date FROM reviews INNER JOIN alerts ON reviews.alert_id = alerts.alert_id WHERE reviews.review_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE country = 'USA';
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY transaction_date DESC;
SELECT flag_id, flag_reason FROM flags WHERE flag_reason LIKE '%fraud%';
SELECT pattern_name, detection_method FROM fraud_patterns;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE country = 'USA';
SELECT user_id, COUNT(transaction_id) AS total_transactions FROM transactions GROUP BY user_id HAVING total_transactions > 5;
SELECT pattern_id, pattern_name, detection_method FROM fraud_patterns WHERE pattern_name LIKE '%money%';
SELECT users.username, transactions.amount, transactions.transaction_date FROM users JOIN transactions ON users.user_id = transactions.user_id;
